unnormalised: What’s the best way to get a personal loan in India? I’m looking to borrow around Rs. 2 lakhs.
normalised: What is the best way to get a personal loan in India? I am looking to borrow around rupee two lakhs.

unnormalised: Well, getting a personal loan can seem daunting, but it's quite straightforward if you know the ropes. Firstly, assess your needs. Figure out exactly how much you need (you mentioned Rs. 2 lakhs) and what you’ll be using the money for. Banks often ask about the purpose of the loan. This will help you decide on the repayment tenure too. Don’t just jump at the first offer you see!

unnormalised: Next, check your CIBIL score. A score of 750+ is generally considered good and will get you better interest rates. You can check your score online through various platforms like CIBIL, Experian, or Equifax. Having a good credit history shows lenders you're responsible with money. If your score is below 700, you might want to work on improving it before applying. This could involve paying off outstanding debts or avoiding late payments for a few months.
normalised: Next, check your C-I-B-I-L score. A score of seven hundred and fifty plus is generally considered good and will get you better interest rates. You can check your score online through various platforms like C-I-B-I-L, Experian, or Equifax. Having a good credit history shows lenders you are responsible with money. If your score is below seven hundred, you might want to work on improving it before applying. This could involve paying off outstanding debts or avoiding late payments for a few months.

unnormalised: Once you know your credit score, start researching different lenders. Banks like SBI, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, and Axis Bank are popular options. NBFCs (Non-Banking Financial Companies) like Bajaj Finserv, Tata Capital, and Mahindra Finance also offer personal loans. Compare interest rates, processing fees, and loan tenures. Look for offers that suit your budget. For example, SBI might offer a loan at 10.5% interest while HDFC could be at 11%. The processing fee might be 2% of the loan amount.
normalised: Once you know your credit score, start researching different lenders. Banks like S-B-I, H-D-F-C Bank, I-C-I-C-I Bank, and Axis Bank are popular options. N-B-F-Cs (Non-Banking Financial Companies) like Bajaj Finserv, Tata Capital, and Mahindra Finance also offer personal loans. Compare interest rates, processing fees, and loan tenures. Look for offers that suit your budget. For example, S-B-I might offer a loan at ten point five percent interest while H-D-F-C could be at eleven percent. The processing fee might be two percent of the loan amount.

unnormalised: Now, gather your documents. Banks typically require proof of identity (Aadhaar card, PAN card, Voter ID), proof of address (utility bills, passport), income proof (salary slips for the last 3 months, bank statements for the last 6 months, Form 16), and sometimes, a photograph. The exact requirements might vary slightly depending on the lender. Make sure you have all these ready before you apply.
normalised: Now, gather your documents. Banks typically require proof of identity (Aadhaar card, P-A-N card, Voter I-D), proof of address (utility bills, passport), income proof (salary slips for the last three months, bank statements for the last six months, Form sixteen), and sometimes, a photograph. The exact requirements might vary slightly depending on the lender. Make sure you have all these ready before you apply.

unnormalised: After preparing your documents, apply online or visit the bank branch. Applying online is usually faster and more convenient. Fill out the application form carefully and upload the necessary documents. The bank will then verify your information and conduct a credit check. If everything checks out, they'll approve your loan. Be prepared to answer any questions the bank might have about your application.

If everything checks out, they will approve your loan. Be prepared to answer any questions the bank might have about your application.

unnormalised: Once your loan is approved, you'll receive a loan agreement. Read it carefully before signing. Pay attention to the interest rate, repayment schedule, penalties for late payments, and any other terms and conditions. If you're happy with everything, sign the agreement and submit it to the bank. The loan amount will then be disbursed to your bank account, usually within a few days.

If you are happy with everything, sign the agreement and submit it to the bank. The loan amount will then be disbursed to your bank account, usually within a few days.

unnormalised: Finally, remember to repay your loan on time! Setting up automatic payments can help you avoid late fees and maintain a good credit score. A personal loan is a useful tool, but it's essential to manage it responsibly. For instance, if you take a Rs. 2 lakh loan for 3 years, even a small difference in interest rate (say 0.5%) can save you thousands of rupees. So, do your research and choose wisely!
